# Mean Energy and Movement Across Scenarios

```{r}
# load libraries
library(data.table)

# plotting
library(ggplot2)
library(glue)
library(patchwork)
library(biscale)
```

## Load energy data

```{r}
load("data/data_energy_move.Rds")
```

Unlist and make larger frame.

```{r}
# unlist
data_energy = data_energy[, unlist(dt, recursive = FALSE), 
            by = setdiff(names(data_energy), "dt")]

# make classes
data_energy = bi_class(
  data_energy,
  x = freqRes,
  y = pTransmit
)

# remove low freq
data_energy = data_energy[freqRes > 0.1,]
```

Select every Nth generation for plotting.

```{r}
data_energy = data_energy[gen %% 10 == 0, ]
```

## Plotting

### Split data by variable and scenario

```{r}
# by variable
data_energy = split(data_energy, by = "variable")

# by scenario
data_energy = lapply(data_energy, function(df) {
  split(df, by = "scenario")
})
```

### Plot energy

```{r}
plot_energy = lapply(data_energy[["energy"]], function(df) {
  
  scenario = unique(df$scenario)
  scenario = dplyr::case_when(
    scenario == 0 ~ "no pathogen",
    scenario == 1 ~ "ancestral pathogen",
    scenario == 2 ~ "spillover pathogen",
    TRUE ~ NA_character_
  )
  
  genmax = max(df$gen)
  
  p = df |>
    ggplot()+
    geom_ribbon(
      aes(
        x = gen,  
        ymin = mean - sd,
        ymax = mean + sd,
        group = replicate
      ),
      fill = alpha("grey", alpha = 0.1)
    )+
    geom_line(
      aes(
        gen, mean, 
        group = replicate,
        col = bi_class
      ),
      show.legend = F
    )+
    bi_scale_color(
      pal = "DkCyan"
    )+
    coord_cartesian(
      expand = F,
      ylim = c(5, 20)
    )+
    facet_grid(
      pTransmit ~ freqRes, 
      scales = "fixed",
      labeller = label_both,
      switch = "y"
    )+
    theme_test()+
    labs(
      x = "Gen.",
      y = "Mean per-capita energy",
      title = glue::glue(
        "scenario: {scenario}"
      )
    )
  
  if (scenario == "spillover pathogen") {
    p = p + geom_vline(
      xintercept = genmax * (2/3),
      col = "red",
      lty = 2
    )
  }
  p
})
```


```{r}
plot = wrap_plots(
  plot_energy
)

ggsave(
  plot = plot,
  filename = "figures/fig_energy_scenario.png"
)
```
